title: How to Clean the Kitchen Before Bed

steps.headline: Get your iPod and speakers and turn it on.
Put away any food that was left out.
steps.description: If you're not sure if it is still good, ask! Nobody wants a stomach ache!

steps.headline: Pick up any clutter or misplaced items (no matter whose they are) and put them in right rooms.
Take out any recycling.
steps.description: If the bins are filling up make a note on the chalk board so we can take them out the next morning.

steps.headline: Fill the sink with water that is as hot as you can touch.
steps.description: Add a tablespoon of dish soap as it fills. Place all hand dishes that need to be soaked in the sink.

steps.headline: Unload the dishwasher if it is full of clean dishes (  if you have a dishwasher.)
Reload the dishwasher - be sure to wipe and rinse any dishes to the point that there is no visible food.
steps.description: Just use a rag - wipe off the big pieces in the disposal side of the sink then rinse and place in dishwasher. If it take more than a minute to clean put in the sink to soak while you get the other dishes. Load them last - by then it should just rinse off.

steps.headline: Put soap in the dishwasher and start it.
Wash any normal hand dishes.
steps.description: Place an extra towel on the counter so they can air dry as you go if you have more than a couple of them. Make sure cups are first, then plates, and nasty pots are last. Dry and put away.

steps.headline: Wash any stones- use the scraper then a clean rag without soap.
Rinse out the sink and wipe it clean with the vinegar all purpose spray and a clean white dish rag.
Wipe the outside of any appliances left on the counter with a clean royal rag.
steps.description: Put away all except microwave and toaster oven.

steps.headline: Wipe off all counters using the vinegar all purpose spray and a white dish rag.
Get a clean white dish rag and wipe off the stove.
steps.description: If there are spots that won't clean after a minute or two use a magic eraser. Don't spend more than a few minutes on each spot!

steps.headline: Empty trash can and wipe the outside of the can than bottom with a dish rag before putting in a new bag.
Place all dirty towels in the cleaning towel basket.
Sweep the kitchen floor, being sure to move the dog bowls, etc so that you can get off of it.
steps.description: Use a dustpan to pick up trash,

steps.headline: Mop the floor.
steps.description: Get the steamer, fill up the water container, make sure it has a clean pad. Plug the steamer in and dance for a minute or two while you mop. Place mop head in cleaning towel basket.

steps.headline: Take a moment and look around.
steps.description: Doesn't it look great (and healthy). Thank You

steps.headline: Turn off the lights and go have some fun!

text: Steps Get your iPod and speakers and turn it on.  Put away any food that was left out. If you're not sure if it is still good, ask! Nobody wants a stomach ache! Pick up any clutter or misplaced items (no matter whose they are) and put them in right rooms.  Take out any recycling. If the bins are filling up make a note on the chalk board so we can take them out the next morning. Dishes Fill the sink with water that is as hot as you can touch. Add a tablespoon of dish soap as it fills. Place all hand dishes that need to be soaked in the sink. Unload the dishwasher if it is full of clean dishes (  if you have a dishwasher.)  Reload the dishwasher - be sure to wipe and rinse any dishes to the point that there is no visible food. Just use a rag - wipe off the big pieces in the disposal side of the sink then rinse and place in dishwasher. If it take more than a minute to clean put in the sink to soak while you get the other dishes. Load them last - by then it should just rinse off. Put soap in the dishwasher and start it.  Wash any normal hand dishes. Place an extra towel on the counter so they can air dry as you go if you have more than a couple of them. Make sure cups are first, then plates, and nasty pots are last. Dry and put away. Wash any stones- use the scraper then a clean rag without soap. Dry and put away. General Cleaning Rinse out the sink and wipe it clean with the vinegar all purpose spray and a clean white dish rag.  Wipe the outside of any appliances left on the counter with a clean royal rag. Put away all except microwave and toaster oven. Wipe off all counters using the vinegar all purpose spray and a white dish rag.  Get a clean white dish rag and wipe off the stove. If there are spots that won't clean after a minute or two use a magic eraser. Don't spend more than a few minutes on each spot! Finishing Up Empty trash can and wipe the outside of the can than bottom with a dish rag before putting in a new bag.  Place all dirty towels in the cleaning towel basket.  Sweep the kitchen floor, being sure to move the dog bowls, etc so that you can get off of it. Use a dustpan to pick up trash, Mop the floor. Get the steamer, fill up the water container, make sure it has a clean pad. Plug the steamer in and dance for a minute or two while you mop. Place mop head in cleaning towel basket. Take a moment and look around. Doesn't it look great (and healthy). Thank You Turn off the lights and go have some fun!
